featured.text: One might think that somewhere a genius thought up the first potato chips, but it didn’t happen that way.
In the 1920s a mechanical potato peeler was invented and soon there were potato chips in abundance.
These were thickly cut potatoes, fried until golden brown and crisp on the outside.
The Moon Lake Restaurant’s menu included French-fried potatoes, a popular food recipe brought back from France by Thomas Jefferson.
The restaurant started selling small packages of the potato chips.

other.text: He was so happy with them that other guests started ordering the new potatoes.
According to this passage, mass production of potato chips was made possible when ________.
Therefore, potato chips are worse than candy because they get stuck between teeth.
By this time the cook was angry and decided to do exactly what the dinner guest wanted: slice the potatoes as thin as possible.
When the paper-thin browned potatoes arrived, the diner was pleased.
The potato chips have been left uncovered on the table for such a long time that they no longer taste fresh and _____.
Potato chips have been popular in the U.S. _______.
One evening a guest in the dining hall felt that his potatoes were too thick and sent them back to the kitchen.
The cook sliced some potatoes thinner than before and prepared them for the complaining guest.

definition.zh_def: 一種常見的根莖類蔬菜，通常呈圓形或橢圓形，外皮粗糙，內部柔軟，富含澱粉。
definition.en_def: A common starchy tuber that is usually round or oval in shape, with a rough skin and soft interior.
definition.example: I like to eat mashed potatoes with gravy.
